intro: Ptilophyllum vittaria, commonly known as the veined moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, elongated leaves that are often covered in a thin layer of translucent cuticle. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas, where it thrives in high humidity. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Ptilophyllum vittaria plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
